name: Fibromuscular Dysplasia
description: Non-atherosclerotic, non-inflammatory vascular disease primarily affecting medium-sized arteries in young to middle-aged women. Characterized by 'string of beads' appearance on angiography. Most commonly involves renal and carotid/vertebral arteries.

statement.text: Fibromuscular dysplasia (FMD) is a non-atherosclerotic, non-inflammatory vascular disease primarily affecting medium-sized arteries in young to middle-aged women, characterized by 'string of beads' appearance on angiography and most commonly involving renal and carotid/vertebral arteries.
statement.formal: FMD: Non-Atherosclerotic Arteriopathy → String of Beads (Beads > Lumen) → Renal (60-75%) + Carotid (25-30%) → PTA Without Stent for Renal, Medical Management for Carotid

explanation.intuition: FMD is NOT cholesterol buildup. It's an abnormality in how the arterial wall forms - creating alternating thick and thin segments that look like a string of beads. Young women get it, and it often causes high blood pressure from kidney artery involvement.
explanation.key_insight: The classic 'string of beads' appearance with beads LARGER than the normal lumen indicates medial fibroplasia (most common type). Unlike atherosclerotic disease, FMD responds excellently to balloon angioplasty WITHOUT stent.
explanation.technical_details: Medial fibroplasia (80-90% of FMD) affects mid-to-distal arteries and is treated with PTA without stent (85-95% cure/improvement for renal hypertension). Intimal fibroplasia causes focal concentric stenosis and may require stent.

medial_fibroplasia.appearance: String of beads (beads LARGER than normal lumen)

diagnosis.characteristic_finding: String of beads with beads LARGER than normal lumen (medial fibroplasia)
diagnosis.screening: Screen for intracranial aneurysms in cerebrovascular FMD

carotid_fmd.symptomatic: Angioplasty or surgery for selected cases

clinical_pearls: String of beads with beads LARGER than lumen = medial fibroplasia (most common)
Young woman with hypertension = think renal FMD
PTA WITHOUT stent for renal FMD (unlike atherosclerotic disease)
Always screen for intracranial aneurysms in cerebrovascular FMD
learning_objectives: Describe the classic angiographic appearance of fibromuscular dysplasia
Explain why stenting is avoided in FMD treatment

enables.title: Renal FMD
enables.reason: Foundation for understanding most common FMD manifestation

sources.citation: Gornik HL, et al. First International Consensus on the diagnosis and management of fibromuscular dysplasia. J Hypertens. 2019;37(2):229-252
Olin JW, et al. The United States Registry for Fibromuscular Dysplasia. Circulation. 2012;125(25):3182-3190
